blog.name: icarus-cosplay
blog.title: -THE GREEN PLACE-
blog.description: Hello! I am Icarus du Soleil, aka Skip. I started cosplaying in 2009 and have been obsessed ever since. I like cosplaying acrobatic heroes and powerful women.

summary: PIKE BUILD PART 1: Sewing the tunic and sash
title: PIKE BUILD PART 1: Sewing the tunic and sash
body:
Okay, I think it’s about time I did a post of how I made my Pike cosplay! This will be in multiple parts. The first part will be how I made the fabric parts like the tunic and the sash. The second part will be how I made all of the armour. The third part will be how I made the mace.

Before I started the cosplay itself, I designed my own version of what I wanted Pike to look like. I initially designed it so I could dress down and just wear the tunic by itself to be a little more casual if I didn’t want to wear the armour. I wanted the tunic to be long and have the Sarenrae symbol incorporated somewhere. I also wanted to have lots of different textures and details, because I really like the idea of Pike wearing ornate things.

I got some blue and gold silk from Etsy for the tunic, I used a crinkle silk for the sash, and a printed cotton for the bandanna. I also got a lot of gold trims for detail.

The fabrics are all really pretty, but I’m not used to sewing with silk, so I made a lot of mistakes on the tunic. I am also going to preface this entire post with saying that I’m going to completely remake the entire tunic with different fabric in the future, because the tunic ended up falling apart because I did not know what I was doing.

I started with the sash because I knew that would be the easiest part. I basically just cut out a long triangle of fabric that would fit around my waist and sewed on the tassels. To give it more flair, I also sewed on some gold lace. It was a very quick and simple project, but looks really nice! I like the way it drapes.

I unfortunately don’t have any pictures of making the bandanna… but I basically just cut out two triangle pieces and sewed them together to make a tube… then flipped them inside out to have a nice seam. Very simple and not super interesting.

The next step was to make the tunic. I started my patterning process by using Simplicity 8293 as my jumping off point then heavily modifying it. I liked the Simplicity pattern because even though the dresses were boxy, it had sleeves, a zipper up the back, and I could easily modify it to have slits up the side. I made sure to have my measurements written out so I could make sure that the pattern would fit me.

I started by making a mockup out of some old bedsheets. Even though the bedsheet fabric behaves differently than the silk I would use, it gave me a good idea of how well my pattern would actually work. I had to take in the sides of the torso a lot and make the sleeves a little bigger before I cut into my real fabric.

I cut out the fabric and included some facing for the collar so it would lay flat and look neat. I used some of my extra bandanna fabric because it was stiffer. I sewed the shoulders and sides together and began hemming the sides to give a clean edge.

Once I tried everything on, I still had to adjust the fit a little bit because it was still too big around the torso area. I also completely messed up the darts for my chest, which is something that became one of the biggest issues with this tunic.

I then installed the zipper… by hand… because I don’t have a zipper foot for my sewing machine. This process took a long time.

There! Things are fitting better! Except for those gosh darn darts…

I then started adding the gold trim… which is another part that gave me a lot of grief. I accidentally bought 1” bias tape when I meant to grab 2”, but I tried to work with it anyway. I used the bias tape because my silk was unraveling around my sewed hem… but then my bias tape started unraveling as well, because the fabric wasn’t a tight weave for either the bias tape or the silk fabric. Very frustrating to work with.

I then added the sleeves. It took me a couple of tries to ease the sleeves into the tunic because the fabric has absolutely no stretch. I also ended up popping a seam in my left arm, which I had to fix by making a new sleeve because I apparently didn’t take into account how buff I am?? (I later ended up popping that same left arm seam during a photoshoot at the con… welp.)

Mostly satisfied with how everything looked, I decided to just wear this version for Fanime because I knew I didn’t have enough time or money to get new fabric and make another one.

When I make my new tunic, I’m going to take this one apart and actually use it as my basis for a new pattern because I now know what to fix. I’m going to look for fabric that has more stretch and breathes a little better, because this silk was really bad on my texture sensitive skin. I’m also going to omit the darts in the future, because I have a small enough chest that I don’t need them.

ANYWAY. My next step was to make the Sarenrae symbol. I decided to paint it on with fabric paint because I didn’t want to attempt applique on this silk. I sketched the symbol with chalk and just painted a couple layers of gold and silver.

And thus! The sewing portion was done! It was quite the learning experience! This was the first time that I ever made something of my own design, so I only had myself to blame for my difficulties ahaha. I hope I can re-make Pike’s tunic soon, because I’d like to re-wear this costume in cooler weather and maybe do another cool photoshoot as well! If you have any questions, please feel free to ask and I’ll do my best to answer them!

ANYWAY. My next step was to make the Sarenrae symbol. I decided to paint it on with fabric paint because I didn’t want to attempt applique on this silk. I sketched the symbol with chalk and just painted a couple layers of gold and silver.

And thus! The sewing portion was done! It was quite the learning experience! I hope I can re-make Pike’s tunic soon, because I’d like to re-wear this costume in cooler weather and maybe do another cool photoshoot as well! If you have any questions, please feel free to ask and I’ll do my best to answer them!

blog.name: twinvax
blog.description: I write and reblog things for my fandoms. Main focus Critical Role. Feel free to send me asks or general headcanons about characters! I have a critical role rp blog! made and role played for Yeza the halfling (chemistyeza.tumblr.com). Asks open!

summary: Regression - Chapter 1 - nofluxgiven, RedTeamShark, Sagittae, TwinVax - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Regression - Chapter 1 - nofluxgiven, RedTeamShark, Sagittae, TwinVax - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 3/6
Fandom: Critical Role (Web Series)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Nott & Caleb Widogast, Nott & The Mighty Nein, Caleb Widogast & The Mighty Nein, Beauregard & Fjord & Frumpkin & Jester & Nott & Mollymauk Tealeaf & Caleb Widogast & Yasha, Caleb Widogast & Nott
Characters: Nott (Critical Role), Caleb Widogast, Fjord (Critical Role), The Mighty Nein
Additional Tags: feeblemind fic, Critical Role Round Robin, Round Robin, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, magical mishaps, Hurt/Comfort, Fluff and Angst, Angst with a Happy Ending, Family Feels, Team as Family
Summary:

When a spell takes Nott’s mind, the Mighty Nein struggle to find a way to get her back before they lose her–and possibly each other–forever.

Updates Mondays!

Third chapter up!

summary: Sometimes after the siblings have had a hard day they sleep in their wolf forms in a big pile like puppies
question: Sometimes after the siblings have had a hard day they sleep in their wolf forms in a big pile like puppies
answer:
I dunno if this is a prompt or a headcanon, but it’s cute either way and I believe it completely!

I’ll leave this as a headcanon for now, and probably do something later by writing a little story for it.

summary:
HI IM BACK. i havent posted any pics in a while but its all good FanEx was GREAT so
 here, have some Caleb selfies! I was SO...
caption:
HI IM BACK. i havent posted any pics in a while but its all good FanEx was GREAT

so here, have some Caleb selfies! I was SO nervous to debut this, since technically it was… kinda rushed (my group wont even be coming together until like… next may). But every critter i ran into was SO NICE and the meetup was a lil nervewracking but i did it! Also got adopted by a Molly at the end of the day and got to do a only slightly heartbreaking impromptu shoot so  👌

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)

My personal blargings

Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

summary:
Liam’s One-Shot: “The Song of the Lorelei” -- Critical Role -- Campaign 2 Special [source] 
Join Dungeon Master Liam O'Brien as...
caption:
Liam’s One-Shot: “The Song of the Lorelei” – Critical Role – Campaign 2 Special [source]

Join Dungeon Master Liam O'Brien as he takes his guests through a werewolf adventure in Wildemount!  The Lorelei siblings return home to discover their castle ransacked, their staff murdered, and their father missing… (With Laura Bailey, Erica Luttrell, Sam Riegel, TJ Storm, and Travis Willingham) 

Critical Awoole

summary: 1) Thank you so much for introducing me to Stole the Show by Kygo it’s amazing  2) it really gives me “Molly meeting Vax in the...
question: 1) Thank you so much for introducing me to Stole the Show by Kygo it’s amazing  2) it really gives me “Molly meeting Vax in the afterlife” vibes which I never thought I would get from a song
answer: Dude that song! I still remember the first time I heard it! It still gets to me, and the first time I heard it they both sprung to my mind so I had to use it! It’s such a nice bittersweet song! I’m glad you like it!

reblog.comment: Dude that song! I still remember the first time I heard it! It still gets to me, and the first time I heard it they both sprung to my mind so I had to use it! It’s such a nice bittersweet song! I’m glad you like it!

blog.name: twinvax
blog.description: I write and reblog things for my fandoms. Main focus Critical Role. Feel free to send me asks or general headcanons about characters! I have a critical role rp blog! made and role played for Yeza the halfling (chemistyeza.tumblr.com). Asks open!

summary: It’s actually really nice that Liam made a point that the Lorelei family was a loving and caring one, and that the siblings...
body:
It’s actually really nice that Liam made a point that the Lorelei family was a loving and caring one, and that the siblings genuinely do love each other despite their teasing instead of play it as them disliking each other and the family being cold because of their lycanthropic heritage. 

It’s a really cute and healing sort of family narrative, that doesn’t really get talked about much in books and stories often.

reblog.comment:

It’s a really cute and healing sort of family narrative, that doesn’t really get talked about much in books and stories often.

It’s a really cute and healing sort of family narrative, that doesn’t really get talked about much in books and stories often.
trail.content:
It’s actually really nice that Liam made a point that the Lorelei family was a loving and caring one, and that the siblings genuinely do love each other despite their teasing instead of play it as them disliking each other and the family being cold because of their lycanthropic heritage. 

It’s a really cute and healing sort of family narrative, that doesn’t really get talked about much in books and stories often.
